cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the construction of linear codes for use in cryptography, which is a topic that falls under the information theory (cs.IT) and cryptography (cs.CR) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the use of Reed-Solomon codes, which are commonly used in error-correcting codes (cs.CC) and data structures (cs.DS). Finally, the paper proposes new code constructions, which could potentially fall under the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI) if the codes are used in network communication.
